title: Saguaro National Park: History & Culture
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture             History & Culture        NPS Photo       Saguaro National Park is not just about cactus. For thousands of years, people have been in this area from prehistoric Hohokam to homesteaders and ranchers. They hunted, planted crops, tended livestock and raised families, leaving their mark on the landscape.       The Beginning of Saguaro National Park Petroglyphs in Saguaro National Park Homesteaders at Saguaro's Rincon Mountain District A Case Study in Preservation A Case Study in Stabilization Airplane Crashes Amole Mining District Archival Conservation Cactus Forest Drive CCC Dams CCC Garbage Receptacles CCC Miscellaneous Features CCC Park Road Signs CCC Picnic Tables and Benches CCC Ramadas CCC Restrooms CCC Serpentine Walls CCC Shelter Houses Cultural Resource Cultural Resource Management Garwood Ranch Brief Help us Preserve Cultural Resources Hohokam Shell Artisans Lime Kilns Mining Claims NPS Rustic Style Observatory Hill Obsidian Sourcing RMD VC Mission 66 Saguaro Fruit A Traditional Harvest Signal Hill Petroglyph
